intro: Hymenopappus polycephalus, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are typically gray-green and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Hymenopappus polycephalus is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in harsh, desert conditions.
